com.madzera.happytree.exception

Class TreeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.madzera.happytree.exception.TreeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class TreeException
extends java.lang.Exception
    The class TreeException represents a checked exception for the HappyTree API, by inheriting the Exception class.

    The TreeException is the only one exception (checked exception) class that can be threw inside of this API. This happens when the following validations does not corresponds:

    • When there is another session with the same identifier, by initializing a new session;
    • When the class of the object to be transformed has not been annotated by @Tree, @Id and @Parent, when initializing a new session;
    • When the annotated attribute @Id and @Parent have different types;
    • When the API Transformation Process was not well processed at Post-Validation phase;
    • When the transaction has no session selected to work;
    • When the current session is not active;
    • When there are mismatch parameterized types when invoking the operations;
    • When there is an attempt of handling an element which does not belong to the current session;
    • When there is an attempt of handling the root element of the tree;
    • When the element to be cut/copied/removes is not with the ATTACHED state in life cycle;
    • When the element to be updated is with the NOT_EXISTED state in life cycle;
    • When the element to be persisted is not with the NOT_EXISTED state in life cycle;
    • When there is an Element object with duplicated id, by trying to insert/update or cut/copy an element between the trees;
    Author:
    Diego Madson de Andrade NÃ³brega

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Default construct for this exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeException

        public TreeException()
        Default construct for this exception. This invocation implies a null details message of the exception as well as the cause.

        To initialize a cause, invoke the Throwable.initCause(Throwable).

      • TreeException

        public TreeException(java.lang.String message)
        This construct allows to specifier a detail message of the exception when it is threw. In this case, the cause of exception is null.

        To initialize a cause, invoke the Throwable.initCause(Throwable).

        Parameters:
        message - the detail message of the exception

      • TreeException

        public TreeException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Create an exception with the specified cause. In this case, the message of the exception will be the message associated to the cause parameter.
        Parameters:
        cause - the cause of the exception

      • TreeException

        public TreeException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Create an exception with the specified message and cause. In this case, the exception will have the detail message set by message parameter and cause as the Throwable.initCause(Throwable).
        Parameters:
        message - the detail message of the exception
        cause - the cause of the exception
